titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: fetched me in his car, & carried me to Waterhouses. Hills, the member, also went with us. The rain came on just about 6 p.m. when the meeting was announced to be held, so we held it under cover of a music hall. There was a crowded assembly of miners mostly young men, just the type for recruiting: but they seemed to lack enthusiasm, & I doubt if our exhortations had much effect.

"Pan–Germanism". It is interesting, and acute, but, perhaps more positive than the author's knowledge warrants. His statement that the United States is part of a coalition with the powers of the 'Entente' is probably apocryphal.
